intro: Coccoloba guanacastensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ecological importance in local habitats.
